titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the New-York Historical Society Printed Materials Collection
circa 1800-1972
MS 3159
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:01 -0400.

did.unittitle: New-York Historical Society printed materials collection
did.abstract: An artifically created collection of printed materials curated and donated by a variety of individuals and institutions. Material includes newspapers and magazines, published books, invitations, pamphlets, certificates, illustrations, pamphlets, and other professionally printed items.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to 20 exposures of stable, unbound material per day.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as: New-York Historical Society printed materials collection, MS 3159, New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection is not processed. As part of a project conducted in 2019-20, archivist Elise Winks performed a high level survey of the collection and described it broadly in this preliminary finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TBD

did.unittitle: Chicago and New York City World's Fair pamphlets

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 box of material from the 1933 Chicago World's Fair and 3 boxes of pamphlets from the 1964-1965 New York City World's Fair.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 box containing typescript lists of post offices and postmasters, directories, and newspapers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An assortment of newspapers collected by Seeback. Includes the New York Times, New York Journal-American, and the New York Sunday News.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 8 boxes containing issues of Harper's Bazaar weekly newspapers.

did.unittitle: Irwin Lutzky materials on folk music

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 boxes and 4 envelopes containing programs and newspaper clippings regarding folk music and dancing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Books, pamphlets, programs, and clippings collected by Mrs. Frederick W. Kobbe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 carton containing books, reports, and pamphlets. Many books and pamphlets are sermons and biographies from the 18th and 19th centuries. Also contains a Civil Defense Information Kit from 1956.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 box containing calligraphy transcripts, created by Bolos, of all the presidental inaugural speeches through 1978.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 envelope containing invitations, programs, and pamphlets for the American Waldensian Aid Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 box of printed material including the will and certificate of citizenship for Gray's father, Jacob Gerson; poetry; newspaper clippings; Yiddish theater programs; and literary journals containing Gray's work. Also contains some correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 envelope containing a composite drawing of work completed by the Turner Construction Company in 1942.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 box of published books and pamphlets regarding poetry, religion, America geography and history, collected by James B. Wilbur.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concert programs for various performances throughout the United States in the late 19th century.

did.unittitle: Uniforms Worn in the War of the American Revolution

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 envelope containing cards showing color illustrations of uniforms worn by soldiers during the Revolutionary War. Cards were published by the New-York Historical Society and have "For Sale Here" written beneath the drawings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 volumes from John Stewart Kennedy's personal library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 envelopes of materials compiled by Greene including pamphlets of annual reports and various oration; a "New England Weekly Journal" page from 1728; and restaurant menus, advertisements, and ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 boxes from the Food and Agriculture Organization's Freedom from Hunger program, containing newspaper clippings and pamphlets about poverty and hunger around the world.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 box containing newspaper pages and clippings from the New York Times featuring photographs of soldiers and scenes from World War I.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 14 bound volumes of the Steinway Hall Programme.

did.unittitle: New York Times Mid-Week Pictorial War Extra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 volume containing several issues of the New York Times Mid-Week Pictorial, all from 1920.

did.unittitle: New York City and Boston newspaper clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 box of loose New York and Boston newspapers, as well as many issues of "Harper's Weekly." Contains a handwritten list of contents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 boxes containing material collected by Becker. Includes newspapers, magazines, pamphlets, some ephemera and memorabilia, handwritten copies of articles and letters written by Becker, membership directories of historical and library societies, and N-YHS annual reports.

did.unittitle: James Wright Brown programs and menus

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folders of programs and menus from luncheons and banquets, as well as awards, nametags, and business cards. Organized by event name and contains an index.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 6 boxes containing newspaper pages and clippings. Box 1 also contains one letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 7 boxes and 2 envelopes containing business ad exhibition pamphlets, New York City postcards, theater programs, and cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One issue eachs of "Flair" and "City of New York Golden Anniversary of Fashion" magazines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Booklets and pamphlets on various historical topics, including the history of Manhattan Beach, Vikings on Cape Cod, typewriters, and doll houses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published books regarding various medical topics. Includes medical dictionaries and encyclopedias, as well as books on chemistry and drugs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Many volumes of "Playboy" magazine belonging to Ivan Nagel. Also some loose pages from the magazine.

did.unittitle: Social clubs local history, and literature publications

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published books regarding various social clubs (1959-1972), history, and literature (circa 1850-1899).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 19 volumes of books on politics.

did.unittitle: History of the United States by George Bancroff

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 6 volumes George Bancroff's "History of the United States," published in 1886. Also includes one In Memoriam program for Phebe Ketchum Thorne.

did.unittitle: Political documents on Andrew Jackson and James Madison

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 envelopes containing loose documents on politics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 5 boxes and 1 envelope of pamphlets consisting of speeches and information about church affairs, finances, and administrative matters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 boxes and 1 envelope of Ulmann's compiled research consisting of newspaper clippings and other writings on New York's transportation, history, and various celebrations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 9 boxes containing pamphlets and catalogs regarding US universities and colleges, religion, and politics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 23 published books on New York history and geography, as well as on some NYC social clubs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 published songbooks, one missing a cover and one entitled "Twice 55 Plus Community Songs."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 22 volumes and 2 envelopes containing published pamphlets and books regarding Walt Whitman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 pamphlets: 2 programs for the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church, 1918 and 1 bulletin for the Merchants and Bankerer's Business School.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published book of Homer C. Davenport's cartoons. Written on the inside cover is "Jane Elizabeth McClelland."
